title: Tughlakabad railway station
text:
Tughlakabad railway station (station code:- TKD) is on the <a href="Kanpur%E2%80%93Delhi%20section">Kanpur–Tundla–Agra–Delhi line</a>. It is located in the Indian state of <a href="Delhi">Delhi</a>. It is operated by <a href="Northern%20Railway%20zone">Northern Railway</a>, <a href="Delhi%20railway%20division">Delhi railway division</a>.
History.
The <a href="Agra%E2%80%93Delhi%20chord">Agra–Delhi chord</a> was opened in 1904. Some parts of it were relaid during the construction of New Delhi (inaugurated in 1927–28).
Passengers.
Tughlakabad railway station serves around 33,000 passengers every day.
Suburban railway.
Tughlakabad is part of the <a href="Delhi%20Suburban%20Railway">Delhi Suburban Railway</a> and is served by <a href="Electrical%20multiple%20units">EMU</a> trains.
Metro link.
<a href="Tughlakabad%20metro%20station">Tughlakabad metro station</a> is about 1 km from Tughlakabad railway station. It is on the <a href="Violet%20Line%20%28Delhi%20Metro%29">Violet Line</a> of <a href="Delhi%20Metro">Delhi Metro</a>. The line operates underground from Kashmere gate till Jangpura metro station. From there it is an elevated line till Raja Nahar Singh (<a href="Ballabhgarh">Ballabhgarh</a>) metro station. The Violet Line was opened up to Sarita Vihar in 2010 and up to Badarpur in 2011.
Loco sheds.
Tughlakabad Diesel Loco Shed houses <a href="Indian%20locomotive%20class%20WDM-2">WDM-2</a>, <a href="WDM-3A">WDM-3A</a>, WDM-3C, <a href="Indian%20locomotive%20class%20WDM-3D">WDM-3D</a>, <a href="Indian%20locomotive%20class%20WDP-1">WDP-1</a>, <a href="Indian%20locomotive%20class%20WDP-3A">WDP-3A</a>, <a href="WDP-4B">WDP-4B</a>, <a href="WDP-4D">WDP-4D</a>, <a href="WAP-1">WAP-1</a> & <a href="WAP-4">WAP-4</a>. It has more than 150 locos.
<a href="Electric%20Loco%20Shed%2C%20Tuglakabad">Tughlakabad Electric Loco Shed</a> is a <a href="West%20Central%20Railway%20zone">West Central Railway</a> shed located in Northern Railway territory. It was a Western Railway shed till 2003. It was originally built to serve freight traffic on the busy Delhi–Mumbai route. It houses more than 250 locos of <a href="Indian%20locomotive%20class%20WAP-7">WAP-7</a> and <a href="Indian%20locomotive%20class%20WAG-9">WAG-9</a>.
Yards and depots.
Tughlakabad marshalling yard is a mechanized hump yard with retarders. It has an Inland Container depot with container freight station and also a domestic container terminal.
